title: Authorized Access Control [CUI Data]
description: Limiting system access to authorized users, processes acting on behalf of authorized users, and devices (including other systems).

objectives.text: authorized users are identified
processes acting on behalf of authorized users are identified
devices (and other systems) authorized to connect to the system are identified
system access is limited to authorized users
system access is limited to processes acting on behalf of authorized users
system access is limited to authorized devices (including other systems)

title: Transaction & Function Control
description: Limit system access to the types of transactions and functions that authorized users are permitted to execute.

objectives.text: roles and permissions are defined based on business and security needs
technical controls enforce allowed transactions/functions per role
privilege elevation is restricted and requires approval or workflow
permissions are reviewed and adjusted periodically

title: Control CUI Flow
description: Control the flow of CUI in accordance with approved authorizations.

objectives.text: policies define allowed paths, protocols, ports, and destinations for CUI
mechanisms (e.g., gateways, firewalls, DLP) enforce flow control
unauthorized exfiltration paths are blocked and monitored
exceptions are documented, approved, and periodically reviewed

title: Separation of Duties
description: Separate duties of individuals to reduce the risk of malevolent activity without collusion.

objectives.text: duties with potential conflicts are identified (e.g., dev vs. prod deploy)
roles and technical controls enforce separation of duties
approved exceptions are documented with compensating controls
separation of duties is reviewed periodically

title: Least Privilege
description: Employ the principle of least privilege, including for specific security functions and privileged accounts.

objectives.text: users and services are granted only the minimum privileges required
write/delete and admin capabilities are restricted when not needed
privilege elevation is time-bound, approved, and logged
privileges are reviewed and revoked when no longer needed

title: Non-Privileged Account Use
description: Use non-privileged accounts or roles when accessing nonsecurity functions.

objectives.text: administrators have separate admin and standard accounts
day-to-day activities use non-privileged accounts
technical controls prevent use of privileged accounts for routine tasks
violations are logged and reviewed

title: Privileged Functions
description: Prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions and audit the execution of such functions.

objectives.text: privileged functions are identified and documented
only authorized privileged users can execute privileged functions
execution of privileged functions is logged with user, time, and outcome
privileged activity logs are reviewed and anomalies addressed

title: Unsuccessful Logon Attempts
description: Limit unsuccessful logon attempts.

objectives.text: a threshold for unsuccessful logon attempts is defined
accounts are locked or sessions terminated upon threshold exceedance
lockout duration and reset conditions are defined and enforced
events are logged and alerts sent as appropriate

title: Privacy & Security Notices
description: Provide privacy and security notices consistent with applicable requirements.

objectives.text: system use notifications are displayed before granting access
users acknowledge or otherwise receive notification consistently
notices are applied for both local and remote access
notice content is approved and maintained

title: Session Lock
description: Use session lock with pattern-hiding displays to prevent access and viewing of data after a period of inactivity or on user request.

objectives.text: inactivity period for session lock is defined
systems automatically invoke session lock after inactivity or on request
unlock requires re-authentication or equivalent

title: Session Termination
description: Terminate or log off user sessions after a defined condition or period.

objectives.text: conditions and time limits for session termination are defined
systems enforce termination for remote and local sessions per policy
termination events are logged as appropriate

title: Control Remote Access
description: Authorize, monitor, and control remote access to the system.

objectives.text: approved remote access methods are defined and documented
remote access requires prior authorization and is limited to approved users/devices
remote sessions are monitored and logged

title: Remote Access Confidentiality
description: Employ cryptographic mechanisms to protect the confidentiality of remote access sessions.

objectives.text: remote access uses FIPS-validated cryptographic modules and strong algorithms
weak protocols/ciphers are disabled and prohibited
key and certificate management practices are defined and implemented

title: Remote Access Routing
description: Route remote access via managed access control points.

objectives.text: all remote access is routed through managed gateways/control points
direct inbound access to internal systems is prevented
centralized logging and monitoring are in place at the control points

title: Privileged Remote Access
description: Authorize remote execution of privileged commands and remote access for privileged functions.

objectives.text: remote privileged access requires explicit authorization and justification
privileged remote access is restricted to managed/admin channels (e.g., bastion)
MFA and strong cryptography are enforced for privileged remote sessions
privileged commands are logged and reviewed

title: Wireless Access Authorization
description: Authorize wireless access prior to allowing such connections.

objectives.text: only approved SSIDs/APs and configurations are allowed
devices/users are authorized before connecting wirelessly
unauthorized wireless connections are prevented and detected

title: Wireless Access Protection
description: Protect wireless access using authentication and encryption.

objectives.text: strong wireless authentication (e.g., 802.1X) and encryption are enforced
shared keys (if used) are rotated and stored securely; WPS is disabled
wireless networks are segmented and monitored for rogue APs

title: Mobile Device Connection
description: Control the connection of mobile devices.

objectives.text: allowed mobile devices and usage conditions are defined
MDM or equivalent enforces security configuration before connection
unapproved or unmanaged devices are blocked from connecting

title: Encrypt CUI on Mobile
description: Encrypt CUI on mobile devices and mobile computing platforms.

objectives.text: full-disk or file-level encryption protects CUI on mobile devices
cryptographic modules are FIPS-validated where required
keys are managed securely; devices support lock and remote wipe

title: External Connections [CUI Data]
description: Verify and control/limit connections to external systems.

objectives.text: external connections are identified, documented, and approved
technical and administrative controls limit external connections to authorized purposes
connections are monitored and reviewed periodically

title: Portable Storage Use
description: Limit the use of portable storage devices on external systems.

objectives.text: use of portable storage is prohibited or requires authorization
approved media are inventoried and, where required, hardware-encrypted
media are scanned for malware and handled per policy

title: Control Public Information [CUI Data]
description: Control information posted or processed on publicly accessible systems; ensure CUI is not posted.

objectives.text: content for public posting is reviewed/approved prior to release
CUI is identified and removed/sanitized before posting
only authorized personnel may post content to public systems

title: Role-Based Risk Awareness
description: Making managers, system administrators, and users aware of the security risks associated with their activities and the applicable policies, standards, and procedures for securing organizational systems.

objectives.text: individuals are made aware of the security risks associated with their activities
individuals are made aware of applicable policies, standards, and procedures
awareness content reflects user roles and organizational context
awareness is provided at onboarding and periodically thereafter
completion of awareness activities is recorded/maintained

title: Role-Based Training
description: Training personnel to carry out assigned information security-related duties and responsibilities.

objectives.text: personnel with information security-related duties are identified
identified personnel receive role-based training appropriate to their duties
training addresses assigned security responsibilities and procedures
training occurs prior to performing duties and periodically thereafter
training completion and content are documented

title: Insider Threat Awareness
description: Providing awareness and training on recognizing and reporting potential indicators of insider threat.

objectives.text: personnel receive awareness on potential indicators of insider threat
reporting mechanisms and points of contact are communicated
procedures for reporting suspected insider threats are accessible and understood
awareness/training is provided initially and periodically
completion of insider threat awareness is recorded/maintained

title: System Auditing
description: Create, protect, and retain audit records to enable monitoring, analysis, investigation, and reporting of unlawful, unauthorized, or inappropriate system activity.

objectives.text: events to be audited are defined based on risk and mission needs
audit records capture sufficient detail (user, event type, date/time, source, outcome)
audit records are protected from unauthorized access, modification, and deletion
audit records are retained per policy, legal, and investigative requirements
audit processes support monitoring, analysis, investigation, and reporting

title: User Accountability
description: Ensure the actions of individual system users can be uniquely traced to those users so they can be held accountable.

objectives.text: users are uniquely identified and authenticated
auditing traces security-relevant user actions to specific user IDs
audit records include sufficient attributes to establish accountability
shared or generic accounts are avoided or compensated with additional controls

title: Event Review
description: Review and update audited events to ensure the logging configuration remains appropriate and effective.

objectives.text: a list of audited events exists and is reviewed periodically
audited events are updated when threats, systems, or missions change
changes to audited events are authorized and documented

title: Audit Failure Alerting
description: Alert in the event of an audit logging process failure.

objectives.text: audit logging failures (e.g., service stopped, storage full) are detected
alerts are generated and sent to designated personnel or systems
failures are tracked to resolution and documented

title: Audit Correlation
description: Correlate audit review, analysis, and reporting for investigation and response to indications of inappropriate, unusual, or suspicious activity.

objectives.text: audit data from multiple sources (hosts, network, apps) is aggregated or made available for correlation
correlation supports detection and investigation of suspicious activity
results of correlation are reported to appropriate personnel

title: Reduction & Reporting
description: Provide audit reduction and report generation to support on-demand analysis and reporting.

objectives.text: capabilities exist to reduce, filter, and summarize audit records
reports can be generated on demand for defined events or time ranges
tools and outputs support investigative and reporting needs

title: Authoritative Time Source
description: Use an authoritative time source for time stamps to support nonrepudiation and forensic analysis.

objectives.text: systems synchronize time with an authoritative source (e.g., NTP, domain time)
audit records include time stamps derived from the authoritative source
time sync failures are detected and corrected

title: Audit Protection
description: Protect audit information and audit tools from unauthorized access, modification, and deletion.

objectives.text: access to audit logs and tools is restricted to authorized roles
integrity protections prevent unauthorized modification of audit data
backups and transfer of audit data preserve confidentiality and integrity

title: Audit Management
description: Limit management of audit logging functionality to a subset of privileged users.

objectives.text: only authorized administrators can enable/disable or configure audit settings
changes to audit configurations are tracked and reviewed

title: System Baselining
description: Establish and maintain baseline configurations and inventories of organizational systems (including hardware, software, firmware) and document, approve, and control changes.

objectives.text: baseline configurations are documented, approved, and maintained
inventories of system components (including CUI-relevant) are maintained
deviations from baseline are detected, analyzed, and reconciled
baselines and inventories are protected and reviewed periodically

title: Security Configuration Enforcement
description: Establish and enforce organization-defined security configuration settings for information technology products employed in organizational systems.

objectives.text: required security configuration settings (e.g., CIS, DISA STIG) are defined
settings are implemented and enforced on all applicable systems
deviations are documented, approved, and justified
configurations are validated and monitored for drift

title: System Change Management
description: Track, review, approve or disapprove, and log changes to organizational systems.

objectives.text: change requests are recorded with description, rationale, and scope
changes are reviewed and approved by authorized personnel
changes are tested/validated and implemented per procedure
an audit trail of changes is maintained (who, what, when, outcome)
emergency changes are documented and subject to after-action review

title: Security Impact Analysis
description: Analyze changes to organizational systems to determine potential security impacts prior to implementation.

objectives.text: proposed changes undergo security impact analysis appropriate to risk
impact, risks, and mitigations are documented and considered in approvals
implementation decisions reflect the results of the impact analysis

title: Access Restrictions for Change
description: Define, approve, and enforce physical and logical access restrictions associated with changes to organizational systems.

objectives.text: only authorized roles may initiate or approve system changes
development, test, and production environments are separated as appropriate
privileges for change are limited, time-bound, and logged
changes occur within approved maintenance windows or controlled processes

title: Least Functionality
description: Employ the principle of least functionality by configuring organizational systems to provide only essential capabilities.

objectives.text: unnecessary features, services, and components are disabled or removed
default accounts, ports, and sample content are removed or secured
periodic reviews ensure systems continue to provide only required functionality

title: Nonessential Functionality
description: Restrict, disable, or prevent the use of nonessential system functionality including ports, protocols, and services.

objectives.text: an inventory of ports, protocols, and services (PPS) is maintained
nonessential PPS are disabled and blocked at appropriate layers
allowlists for necessary PPS are documented and enforced
exceptions are approved, documented, and reviewed periodically

title: Application Execution Policy
description: Apply deny-by-default/allow-by-exception policy to allow the execution of authorized software and prevent execution of unauthorized software.

objectives.text: a policy defines authorized software and execution conditions
technical controls enforce an execution allowlist/denylist (e.g., AppLocker, WDAC)
allowlist changes are controlled, approved, and logged
attempted execution of unauthorized software is blocked and alerted

title: User-Installed Software
description: Control and monitor the use of user-installed software.

objectives.text: users are prohibited from installing software without authorization
requests for software are assessed for need, licensing, and security
authorized installations are inventoried and monitored
unauthorized software is detected and removed; violations are addressed

title: Identification [CUI Data]
description: Identify information system users, processes acting on behalf of users, and devices.

objectives.text: all users are uniquely identified
processes acting on behalf of users are identified and traceable
devices (and other systems) authorized to connect are uniquely identified

title: Authentication [CUI Data]
description: Authenticate (or verify) the identities of users, processes, or devices as a prerequisite to allowing access to organizational systems.

objectives.text: authentication is required before granting access
authentication mechanisms are appropriate for user, process, or device type
failed authentication attempts are logged and reviewed

title: Multifactor Authentication
description: Use multifactor authentication for local and network access to privileged accounts and for network access to non-privileged accounts.

objectives.text: MFA is enforced for privileged accounts (local and network)
MFA is enforced for network access to non-privileged accounts
MFA factors are independent and meet organizational strength requirements
exceptions are documented and approved with compensating controls

title: Replay-Resistant Authentication
description: Employ replay-resistant authentication mechanisms for network access to privileged and non-privileged accounts.

objectives.text: authentication protocols are resistant to replay (e.g., challenge-response, mutual auth)
no reusable plaintext secrets are transmitted
protections apply to both privileged and non-privileged network access

title: Identifier Reuse
description: Prevent reuse of identifiers for a defined period.

objectives.text: policies define identifier reuse restrictions (e.g., usernames, IDs)
systems prevent reassignment of identifiers within the defined period
identifier lifecycle actions (create, disable, delete) are recorded

title: Identifier Management
description: Disable identifiers after a defined period of inactivity and manage identifier lifecycle.

objectives.text: inactivity period for disabling identifiers is defined and enforced
identifiers are issued, disabled, and removed per documented procedures
departed users' identifiers are promptly disabled and removed

title: Password Complexity
description: Enforce password complexity and strength requirements.

objectives.text: password composition rules and length meet organizational requirements
passwords are checked against known-compromised lists where feasible
initial/temporary passwords are changed at first use

title: Password Reuse
description: Prohibit password reuse for a defined number of generations.

objectives.text: password history length is defined
systems prevent reuse of recent passwords per policy

title: Temporary Passwords
description: Allow temporary passwords only with required complexity and for limited use.

objectives.text: temporary passwords meet complexity requirements and expire quickly
temporary passwords are issued securely and changed at first use

title: Cryptographically-Protected Passwords
description: Store and transmit only cryptographically protected passwords.

objectives.text: passwords are stored using strong, salted one-way hashes
passwords are transmitted only over encrypted channels

title: Obscure Feedback
description: Obscure feedback of authentication information to protect the unauthorized use of such information.

objectives.text: authentication prompts do not reveal sensitive hints (e.g., which factor failed)
display of secrets (passwords, PINs) is masked or hidden
error messages are generic and do not disclose account existence

title: Incident Handling
description: Establish an operational incident-handling capability for organizational systems that includes preparation, detection and analysis, containment, eradication, and recovery.

objectives.text: incident response plan and procedures define roles, phases, and communications
capabilities exist to detect, analyze, contain, eradicate, and recover from incidents
incident records are maintained, including timelines, actions, and outcomes
post-incident reviews drive corrective actions and lessons learned

title: Incident Reporting
description: Track, document, and report incidents to appropriate officials and/or authorities both internal and external to the organization.

objectives.text: incident categories, severities, and reporting timelines are defined
incidents are documented and reported to designated internal roles
external reporting obligations (e.g., customers, regulatory) are identified and met

title: Incident Response Testing
description: Test the organizational incident response capability.

objectives.text: incident response exercises/tests are conducted at a defined frequency
tests involve relevant stakeholders and cover realistic scenarios
findings and gaps from tests are documented and tracked to closure

title: Perform Maintenance
description: Perform maintenance on organizational systems in a controlled and authorized manner.

objectives.text: scheduled and emergency maintenance procedures are defined and authorized
maintenance activities are documented (date/time, personnel, components, actions)
maintenance is performed by authorized personnel following approved procedures
post-maintenance validation verifies system functionality and security settings

title: System Maintenance Control
description: Provide controls on the tools, techniques, mechanisms, and personnel used to conduct system maintenance.

objectives.text: maintenance tools are approved, controlled, and protected from unauthorized use
tools introduced to systems are scanned/checked and removed after use
maintenance activities are monitored/supervised as appropriate
records of maintenance tools/personnel and sessions are maintained

title: Equipment Sanitization
description: Ensure equipment removed for off-site maintenance is sanitized of CUI.

objectives.text: equipment containing CUI is sanitized prior to off-site maintenance
sanitization and chain-of-custody are documented
sanitization is verified and records are retained

title: Media Inspection
description: Check media containing diagnostic and test programs for malicious code before use in organizational systems.

objectives.text: diagnostic/test media are scanned for malicious code prior to use
only authorized and trusted media are allowed for maintenance activities
use of removable media is controlled and logged where applicable

title: Nonlocal Maintenance
description: Authorize, monitor, and control nonlocal maintenance and diagnostic activities; terminate remote sessions when complete.

objectives.text: nonlocal maintenance is approved in advance and limited to authorized personnel
strong cryptography and MFA protect remote maintenance sessions
nonlocal maintenance is monitored and logged
remote connections are terminated when maintenance is complete or at anomalies

title: Maintenance Personnel
description: Ensure maintenance personnel are fully vetted; supervise maintenance when personnel lack required authorization.

objectives.text: maintenance personnel are screened/vetted per policy
personnel without required authorization are escorted/supervised during maintenance
maintenance access is limited to necessary areas and duration
records of maintenance personnel, dates, and activities are maintained

title: Media Protection
description: Protect information system media, both paper and digital, containing CUI.

objectives.text: media that may contain CUI are identified and handled per policy
physical and technical safeguards protect media at rest and in transit
access to media is limited to authorized personnel
protections are commensurate with sensitivity and risk

title: Media Access
description: Limit access to CUI on information system media to authorized users.

objectives.text: media access is restricted and requires authorization
storage locations (file shares, cabinets) have access controls applied
removal of media from controlled areas is tracked and approved

title: Media Disposal [CUI Data]
description: Sanitize or destroy information system media containing CUI before disposal or release for reuse.

objectives.text: sanitization and destruction methods meet policy/standard (e.g., NIST SP 800-88)
sanitization/destruction is documented with date, method, and authorizer
media are verified sanitized/destroyed prior to disposal or reuse

title: Media Markings
description: Mark media with necessary CUI markings and distribution limitations.

objectives.text: media containing CUI are labeled/marked as required
digital equivalents (banners/metadata) are applied where feasible
markings are accurate and kept current throughout the media lifecycle

title: Media Accountability
description: Ensure accountability for media containing CUI.

objectives.text: media inventories and/or checkout logs are maintained as appropriate
movement and transfer of media are authorized and tracked
loss or theft of media is reported and investigated

title: Portable Storage Encryption
description: Encrypt CUI on portable storage devices.

objectives.text: approved encryption is required on portable storage containing CUI
keys and passphrases are managed per policy
unencrypted portable storage use is prevented or tightly controlled

title: Removable Media
description: Control the use of removable media on system components.

objectives.text: use of removable media is restricted to authorized need
technical controls limit or disable removable media where feasible
media are scanned for malware before use and upon insertion

title: Shared Media
description: Prohibit or control the use of shared media on systems processing CUI.

objectives.text: shared media use is prohibited or explicitly authorized with controls
where shared media is used, CUI is protected via encryption and access controls
procedures define sanitization/segregation when media are reused

title: Personnel Screening
description: Screen individuals prior to authorizing access to organizational systems containing CUI.

objectives.text: pre-employment and/or pre-access screening is conducted per policy and law
screening results inform access authorization decisions
screening documentation is retained per retention requirements

title: Personnel Termination
description: Upon termination or transfer, revoke access and retrieve organizational assets.

objectives.text: accounts and credentials are disabled/removed promptly upon termination or transfer
organizational assets (badges, keys, devices, media) are recovered
access lists and authorizations are updated
termination/transfer checklist is completed and retained

title: Limit Physical Access
description: Limit physical access to organizational systems, equipment, and operating environments to authorized individuals.

objectives.text: physical access authorizations are defined and approved
access to areas housing CUI systems is limited to authorized individuals
access points are controlled (e.g., locks, card readers)

title: Protect and Monitor Facilities
description: Protect and monitor the physical facility and support infrastructure for organizational systems.

objectives.text: facilities have physical protections (e.g., guards, cameras, intrusion detection)
environmental controls (power, HVAC) are protected and monitored
monitoring records/alerts are retained and reviewed

title: Visitor Escort and Monitoring
description: Escort visitors and monitor visitor activity in areas where CUI systems are present.

objectives.text: visitors are identified, issued badges, and escorted at all times
visitor access is restricted to authorized areas and purposes
visitor activity is monitored and any anomalies are addressed

title: Physical Access Logging
description: Maintain audit logs of physical access to areas housing organizational systems.

objectives.text: logs of physical access are maintained (badges, sign-in/out, logs)
physical access logs are protected from tampering and retained per policy
logs are reviewed for anomalies and investigated as needed

title: Manage Physical Access Devices
description: Control and manage physical access devices (e.g., keys, locks, combinations, card readers).

objectives.text: physical access devices are inventoried and issuance is controlled
combinations/keys are changed when compromised or personnel depart
administration of access devices is limited to authorized personnel

title: Enforce Access at Entry Points
description: Enforce physical access authorizations for all physical access points to systems and equipment.

objectives.text: all entry/exit points to CUI areas enforce access authorizations
tailgating and piggybacking are deterred and detected
visitor access points are controlled and monitored

title: Periodic Risk Assessment
description: Periodically assess the risk to organizational operations, organizational assets, and individuals resulting from the operation of organizational systems and the associated processing, storage, or transmission of CUI.

objectives.text: risk assessment methodology and cadence are defined
threats, vulnerabilities, likelihood, and impact are analyzed for CUI systems
results are documented and inform risk response decisions
assessments are updated upon significant changes and at defined intervals

title: Vulnerability Scanning
description: Scan for vulnerabilities in organizational systems and applications periodically and when new vulnerabilities potentially affecting the systems are identified and reported.

objectives.text: scope, frequency, and tools for scanning are defined (authenticated where feasible)
vulnerability data sources are monitored for newly disclosed issues
scan results are analyzed, prioritized, and tracked to remediation
rescan validates remediation and confirms risk reduction

title: Vulnerability Remediation
description: Remediate vulnerabilities in accordance with risk assessments.

objectives.text: timeframes for remediation are defined by severity/risk
patching, configuration changes, or mitigations are implemented and verified
exceptions are approved with compensating controls and tracked

title: Security Controls Assessment
description: Periodically assess the security controls in organizational systems to determine if the controls are effective in their application.

objectives.text: assessment plan defines scope, methods, and frequency
assessments evaluate control implementation and effectiveness
assessment results are documented and shared with stakeholders

title: Plan of Action and Milestones (POA&M)
description: Develop and implement plans of action designed to correct deficiencies and reduce or eliminate vulnerabilities in organizational systems.

objectives.text: deficiencies are documented with risk, remediation tasks, and owners
target dates and milestones are established and tracked
progress is monitored and plans are updated until closure

title: Continuous Monitoring
description: Monitor security controls on an ongoing basis to ensure the continued effectiveness of the controls.

objectives.text: a continuous monitoring strategy defines metrics, frequencies, and responsibilities
automated/manual activities collect, analyze, and report control status
findings drive risk response and updates to POA&Ms/SSP

title: System Security Plan (SSP)
description: Develop, document, and periodically update system security plans that describe system boundaries, operating environments, how security requirements are implemented, and relationships with or connections to other systems.

objectives.text: SSP documents system boundary, environment, and interconnections
implementation of each applicable control is described
SSP is reviewed/updated when systems or risks change and at defined intervals

title: Boundary Protection
description: Monitor, control, and protect communications at the external boundaries and key internal boundaries of organizational systems.

objectives.text: external and key internal boundaries are identified and documented
mechanisms (e.g., firewalls, gateways) control and monitor communications
unapproved communications are blocked and alerts are generated as appropriate

title: Security Function Isolation
description: Employ architectural designs and separation mechanisms to prevent unauthorized and unintended information transfer and to isolate security functions.

objectives.text: security functions are isolated from non-security functions
mechanisms prevent unauthorized/unintended information transfer
designs promote separation of user/system functions as appropriate

title: Separate Management Functions
description: Separate user functionality from system management functions to reduce risk.

objectives.text: management interfaces and functions are separate from user functions
only authorized admin roles can access management functionality
management activities are logged and reviewed

title: Shared Resource Isolation
description: Prevent unauthorized and unintended information transfer via shared system resources.

objectives.text: shared resources are managed to prevent data leakage (e.g., memory, storage)
controls mitigate covert storage or timing channels where feasible

title: Publicly Accessible Subnetworks
description: Implement subnetworks for publicly accessible system components that are physically or logically separated from internal networks.

objectives.text: public-facing components are isolated (e.g., DMZ)
only required traffic between DMZ and internal network is allowed
traffic is monitored at trust boundaries

title: Deny by Default
description: Deny network communications traffic by default and allow only authorized communications.

objectives.text: default-deny rules are implemented at appropriate layers
allow rules are documented, justified, and periodically reviewed

title: Prevent Unauthorized Communications Paths
description: Prevent remote devices from communicating with internal systems unless explicitly authorized and managed.

objectives.text: remote connections are limited to managed access paths
split tunneling is prevented for remote sessions unless authorized and secured

title: Cryptographic Protection (In Transit)
description: Implement cryptographic mechanisms to prevent unauthorized disclosure of CUI during transmission unless otherwise protected by alternative controls.

objectives.text: CUI in transit is encrypted using approved protocols and ciphers
keys/certificates are managed securely and rotated per policy

title: Terminate Network Sessions
description: Terminate network connections associated with communications sessions at the end of the session or after a defined period of inactivity.

objectives.text: conditions/timeouts for session termination are defined and enforced
termination applies to remote and local network sessions as appropriate

title: Session Authenticity
description: Protect the authenticity of communications sessions (e.g., via mutual authentication, integrity checks).

objectives.text: mechanisms ensure session authenticity and integrity (e.g., TLS, signed tokens)
session hijacking and downgrade attempts are mitigated

title: FIPS-Validated Cryptography
description: Employ FIPS-validated cryptography when used to protect the confidentiality of CUI.

objectives.text: cryptographic modules are FIPS-validated where required
configuration enforces the use of approved algorithms and key lengths

title: Collaborative Computing Devices
description: Prohibit remote activation of collaborative computing devices and provide indication of devices in use to users present at the device.

objectives.text: remote activation of cameras/microphones is prevented unless authorized
visible indicators signal when devices are in use

title: Mobile Code
description: Control and monitor the use of mobile code (e.g., scripts, macros, Java).

objectives.text: policies define approved mobile code types and usage conditions
execution of disallowed mobile code is prevented and monitored

title: VoIP Control
description: Control and monitor the use of Voice over Internet Protocol (VoIP) technologies.

objectives.text: VoIP deployment is authorized and follows secure configuration
VoIP traffic is segmented/secured and monitored

title: Network Disconnect
description: Implement automatic disconnect of sessions after a defined period of inactivity.

objectives.text: network disconnect timeouts are defined and enforced
disconnect applies to remote/management sessions per policy

title: Protect CUI at Rest
description: Protect the confidentiality of CUI at rest.

objectives.text: CUI at rest is encrypted or otherwise protected per policy
keys are managed securely and access is limited on a need-to-know basis

title: Prevent Non-Privileged Unencrypted Sessions
description: Protect the confidentiality of remote sessions for non-privileged users as required (e.g., via encryption).

objectives.text: unencrypted remote sessions for non-privileged users are prohibited where CUI may be exposed
approved encrypted remote access methods are enforced

title: Non-Repudiation (Session Protection)
description: Protect communications sessions to provide assurances of origin and integrity as required for non-repudiation.

objectives.text: mechanisms support attribution of actions to specific entities
session integrity protections are enabled for sensitive communications

title: Collaborative Computing Content Management
description: Control and monitor content shared through collaborative technologies to prevent unauthorized disclosure of CUI.

objectives.text: controls prevent unauthorized sharing/recording of CUI via collaboration tools
policies govern approved platforms and features (e.g., screen share)

title: External Telecommunication Services
description: Implement a managed interface for external telecommunication services and protect the confidentiality and integrity of information being transmitted.

objectives.text: connections to external services use managed interfaces/gateways
protections (e.g., encryption, filtering) are applied to external communications

title: Flaw Remediation
description: Identify, report, and correct information and information system flaws in a timely manner.

objectives.text: process exists to identify, track, and remediate system flaws
patches/updates are tested and applied per defined timeframes
remediation actions are documented and verified

title: Malicious Code Protection
description: Provide protection from malicious code at appropriate locations within organizational systems.

objectives.text: anti-malware is deployed at endpoints/servers as appropriate
malware protections run with real-time/on-access scanning enabled
protections are centrally managed and monitored where feasible

title: Security Alerts and Advisories
description: Monitor system security alerts and advisories and take appropriate actions in response.

objectives.text: sources of security alerts/advisories are monitored (e.g., vendor, US-CERT)
relevant alerts are evaluated and actions are tracked to completion

title: Update Malicious Code Protection
description: Update malicious code protection mechanisms when new releases are available.

objectives.text: definitions/engines are updated automatically or on a defined cadence
update failures generate alerts and are remediated

title: System Scanning
description: Perform periodic scans of organizational systems and real-time scans of files from external sources as files are downloaded, opened, or executed.

objectives.text: periodic scans are scheduled and cover applicable systems
real-time scanning is enabled for files from external sources
scan results are reviewed and remediated

title: Monitoring for Intrusions
description: Monitor the system to detect attacks and indicators of potential attacks and unauthorized local, network, and remote connections.

objectives.text: monitoring detects potential attacks and unauthorized connections
alerts are analyzed and incidents are escalated per procedure

title: Identify Unauthorized Use
description: Identify unauthorized use of organizational systems.

objectives.text: unauthorized use of the system is identified
suspected or confirmed unauthorized use is reported and investigated
